journal-title-group.journal-title: Russian & East European Finance and Trade

title-group.article-title: Structural Adaptation and Its Mechanism for Protecting Domestic Industries: Part Two: The In-Depth Protection of Hungarian Industries

abstract.p: In the second part of this study, the author analyzes the Hungarian system of protecting industries. Since his goal is to determine the state of affairs rather than to formulate proposals, he does not go into details concerning the association agreement between Hungary and the EC and its potential effects on industry policy in Hungary. Rather, in accordance with conclusions drawn from the international analysis contained in the previous article, he concludes that the focus of industrial protection should be shifted from tariffs to nontariff barriers. This would give new meaning to the tariff cuts obtained from the EC as well as to the restrictions Hungary has promised to introduce as a precondition for EC association.
